JD
John DoeSales Manager

Playbook

Playbook

Rules, stop signals, and drills. The single source of truth.

Active Rules (3)
Rules the team should follow right now
Proven

If/When: Prospect says they're 'happy with current provider'

Then: Ask: 'What would need to change for you to consider alternatives?'

Because: Opens the door to future pain without being pushy

Likely

If/When: Calling trucking companies before 8am

Then: Lead with operational efficiency angle, not cost savings

Because: Early morning decision makers are operationally focused

Proven

If/When: Gatekeeper asks 'What is this regarding?'

Then: Be direct: 'I'm calling about your fleet operations - is [Name] available?'

Because: Vague answers trigger more gatekeeping; directness gets transfers

Stop Signals (5 active)
Automatic alerts during dial sessions. When thresholds are crossed, you will be prompted to start a corrective drill.
Trust Problem
Active

High skepticism indicates your opener isn't establishing credibility fast enough.

Trigger:Why = Trust >= 35% of last 20 DM-connected calls
Recommended drill:Trust Builder
10 calls

For the next 10 connects, lead with a specific industry insight before asking questions. Reference a real stat or trend.

Value Problem
Active

Without uncovering pain, prospects have no reason to change.

Trigger:Why = Value >= 40% of last 20 DM-connected calls
Recommended drill:Value Finder
10 calls

Focus exclusively on uncovering pain. Ask at least 3 follow-up questions about their current situation before discussing solutions.

Access Problem
Active

Half your calls are getting stopped at the gate.

Trigger:DM reach rate < 10% over last 30 calls
Recommended drill:Gatekeeper Ally
15 calls

Treat gatekeepers as allies. Learn their name, be curious about their role, ask for their help navigating.

Execution Problem
Active

Rep mistakes are spiking - time to slow down and reset.

Trigger:Rep Mistakes >= 3 in last 15 connected calls
Recommended drill:Slow Down
10 calls

Consciously slow your pace by 20%. Pause for 2 seconds after each prospect response before speaking.

Closing Problem
Active

You're having good conversations but not converting them to meetings.

Trigger:DM Interested >= 8 AND Meeting set = 0
Recommended drill:Confident Closer
10 calls

End every connected call with a clear, confident ask for a specific meeting time. No soft closes.

Drills (5)
Corrective exercises triggered by stop signals
Trust Builder
trust
10 calls

For the next 10 connects, lead with a specific industry insight before asking questions. Reference a real stat or trend.

"I was just reading that [industry] companies are seeing [specific trend]. We've been helping folks like [similar company] navigate that. Does that resonate?"

Value Finder
value
10 calls

Focus exclusively on uncovering pain. Ask at least 3 follow-up questions about their current situation before discussing solutions.

"What's the biggest challenge with [area]? How long has that been going on? What have you tried? What's that costing you?"

Gatekeeper Ally
access
15 calls

Treat gatekeepers as allies. Learn their name, be curious about their role, ask for their help navigating.

"Hi [Name], this is [You] - I'm hoping you can point me in the right direction. Who typically handles [area] there?"

Slow Down
execution
10 calls

Consciously slow your pace by 20%. Pause for 2 seconds after each prospect response before speaking.

"Based on what you've shared, I think we could help. I have Tuesday at 2pm or Thursday at 10am - which works better?"

Confident Closer
closing
10 calls

End every connected call with a clear, confident ask for a specific meeting time. No soft closes.

"Based on what you've shared, I think we could help. I have Tuesday at 2pm or Thursday at 10am - which works better?"
